headline: Why consumer staple stocks like Walmart & Costco crushed it in 2024
summary: The Consumer Staples Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLP) is seeing steady gains this year, rising more than 10%. Market Domination Overtime host Akiko Fujita names some of the top performers including Walmart (WMT), Costco (COST), Philip Morris (PM), and Colgate-Palmolive (CL). Walmart is on track for its biggest annual share price gain in decades. On the other hand, Costco continues to drive in big gains with cost-conscious consumers and growth in its e-commerce businesses. Another consumer doing well is Philip Morris — with the tobacco consumer gaining 30% in its smoke-free products. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Josh Lynch

headline: 3 Retail Discount Stocks Positioned to Outperform in 2025
summary: Discount stocks, such as COST, TJX and BURL, have shown a consistent ability to perform well, even when broader market indices may experience volatility.
